page.title: 16FARMING AT CHATTENDEN
page.content: Mr Ballard runs a farm of 175 acres in seven fields. Five are at Chattenden, one at Upnor and one at Wainscott. The largest of the fields is 25 acres and the smallest is six. Mr Ballard's father started farming in Wainscott 75 years ago with 10 acres. He bought the farm at Chattenden in 1941. Mr Ballard has been a farmer here for 45 years. The fields at Chattenden are used for growing Wheat and Barley because the soil is heavy and difficult to cultivate.The corn is planted in the Winter and the cold weather breaks up the soil ready for the corn to grow in Spring.
